data.title: Use IWindowInfo.Handle to retrieve window handle
data.body:
(PR re-issued after rebase fail at https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2166)

OpenTK 1.1 offers a public GameWindow.WindowInfo.Handle property. This patch removes reflection from the startup path in favor of accessing the Handle property directly.

This patch depends on https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies/pull/43

data.title: Bugfix #2172 - TextureProcessorOutputFormat.DXTCompressed, does not matc...
data.body: ...h original XNA capitalization

data.title: Delete the GLSL program on link failure in ShaderProgramCache.
data.body: The program created in the beginning of the link process will now be properly deleted should it fail.

data.title: Inconsistent Flick Gestures on MonoGame Android
data.body:
There appears to be some issues with Flick gestures on Android when using MonoGame.

I noticed in my own game that seemingly at random I would get huge spikes in flick "strength" on Android. I also found that, in general, flick delta information seems inconsistent; eg. I do the same finger motion multiple times in a row and get different results. These may be 2 different issues.

To test the issue I ported the XNA Gesture Sample to MonoGame Android.

Here is is the original sample: http://xbox.create.msdn.com/en-US/education/catalog/sample/gestures

After testing the Gesture Sample in MonoGame Android, I can confirm that the issue also occurs there. I have recorded a video and uploaded it here:

https://skydrive.live.com/redir?resid=8F4382671CE40FEA!238&authkey=!AJBQaQdkDymzitQ&ithint=video%2c.mp4

It is a fairly long video (2 mins), but here is a break down:
- I am basically doing the same flick gesture over and over.
- The text on screen shows the value of gesture.Delta and gesture.Delta.Length() when gesture.GestureType is GestureType.Flick.
- Usually gesture.Delta.Length() is anywhere from 500 to 3000, which is fairly inconsistent unto itself and feels very different from the WP version.
- At 0:55 you can see the first major spike, when gesture.Delta.Length() jumps to 7000; higher than I am able to get usually even when flicking as fast as possible.
- At 1:50 you can see the second major spike, when gesture.Delta.Length() jumps to almost 25,000!

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/310185/1828614/ee1eb08c-725e-11e3-83c4-5c0152b56959.png)

data.title: Adding support for Exit() in metro apps.
data.body:
It appears that the Exit() method is not implemented for metro apps. Currently, even after Exit() is called the game continues to Tick and Update\Draw calls continue. 

Disposing doesn't work because Ticks continue to happen.

This change stops the ticks and allows the game to be disposed.

data.title: [WP8] Create Debug Device only under DEBUG configuration
data.body:
improve performance under release builds.
We don't have to create a Debug device.

data.title: COM objects in SharpDX need to be disposed explicitly
TextureProcessorOutputFormat.DXTCompressed, does not match original XNA capitalization
data.body:
Concerning the enum name:
TextureProcessorOutputFormat.DXTCompressed

There appears to be an inadvertent capitalization change...

XNA:
DxtCompressed

MonoGame:
DXTCompressed

data.title: Missing types: NormalizedByte4, NormalizedByte2
data.body:
The windows build of monogame is missing these two types:
NormalizedByte4
NormalizedByte2

Stock XNA contains them in the following namespace:
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PackedVector

Reference:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.packedvector.aspx

data.title: SharpDX Performance issues on WP8.
data.body:
I have noticed that calls to SharpDX functions on WP8 is 3 to 4 times slower than XNA.  
ex: _d3dContext.DrawIndexed() inside DrawUserIndexedPrimitives takes ~3 times longer to execute than calling DrawUserIndexedPrimitives from a similar XNA project on the same device. 

In comparison, due to CPU overhead from sharpDX calls, the same project that run at 60fps with XNA at Lumia 800, drops to 22fps on Lumia 620 with Monogame!   

I though that SharpDX was supposed to be ~x1.5 slower than native DX while XNA was x9 times slower. Which means that either XNA does a clever trick on WP7/8 or SharpDX has issues with interop on WP8. 

Has anyone observe anything similar?

data.title: Fixes an error on the iOS Keyboard
data.body:
This error happens when the orientation is on landscape. The
uitextfield just goes off screen and you can’t see what you type.
It happens to be just a wrong logic inside KeyboardInputViewController.

data.title: Fix vertical font padding in SharpFontImporter
data.body:
This fixes the vertical font padding in the SharpFontImporter.  Currently fonts imported in the MonoGame content pipeline look like this when rendered:

![fontbroken](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2063515/1771050/e1b8c088-67a7-11e3-8560-0538db765e65.PNG)

This change ensures that fonts are rendered correctly; after this change it looks like this:

![fontfixed](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2063515/1771052/f2a0a122-67a7-11e3-8804-b18731086f5c.PNG)

data.title: 2MGFX does not work on non-Windows platforms
data.body: I'm assuming that 2MGFX is not meant to compile under Linux.  Are there any intentions to change this in the future so that compilation can be done on non-Windows platforms?

data.body:
Hi,
I'm beginer with MonoGame. 
I use visual studio 2012.
When I try to execute my first MonoGame project (empty project) the following error appears: (Unable to find an entry point named 'glBindFramebuffer' in DLL 'opengl32.dll')

![capture](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6093011/1750164/e4fb9da6-6572-11e3-838b-649ef632ac57.PNG)

--- Windows 8.1
--- Graphic card: Intel(R) G41 Express Chipset (Microsoft Corporation - WDDM 1.1)
--- Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU E7500 @ 2.93GHz

Please, any one can helps me.

data.title: Can we solve this FPS issue.
data.body:
After about 11 months nothing has changed https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1184. MonoGame has timing issues and really should be looked at how the SharpDX toolkit has implemented them. Some developers sense that SharpDX TK has somewhat copied from XNA. XNA is abandoned by Microsoft. I don't see why they would follow up something that looks "similar" to XNA. I am no lawyer, but even if they did what could happen? Who would be liable? I would be as simple as removing the "offending" code.

The point of vertical synchronization is so the FPS becomes locked to the monitors refresh rate. Because of MonoGame's tick loops Vsync is not achieved at all. Frames become skipped/jumpy so often.

If you want a smooth 2D or even 3D fixed 60 FPS step sidescroller, MonoGame at this point in time is still a bad choice.

The issue comes down to the game loop going out of accuracy due to how stopwatch works. Somehow SharpDX TK handles this fine.

I will be investigating and hopefully adding a fix. It will most probably be based off the SharpDX TK code.

data.title: Added Right and Left Orientation to template
Controller mappings for PS3 (official and generic).
data.body:
Also added XNA-style ToString() overrides to a few of the GamePad subordinates to aid in debugging.

Only tested on OS X, using official PS3 controller, and a GameStop knock-off PS3 controller.

Issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2154

Rationale: Using PS3 controllers in OS X is a breeze compared to the 360 -- especially in Mavericks, where the tattiebogle drivers don't seem to work any more. Nothing to install, just plug the PS3 controller into the USB port. (Even the wireless works with a mini USB cord.)

data.title: Fix for frame buffer exception on exit (at least with OS X). Should be a...
data.body:
Fix for Crash after Exit() on Mac OS X. Affects all platforms, but should be a low-risk change.

Issue: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2155

data.title: WP8: OnExiting not being called when calling Game.Exit
data.body:
The Platform.Exit function  calls  System.Windows.Application.Current.Terminate(); , which instantly terminates the app, without giving the app time to call DoExiting 

(UnloadContent is also not called)

data.body:
In order to work with MonoGame within Xamarin Studio for Windows, you have to install openal.dll from here:

data.title: Crash After Exit() on Mac OS X
PS3 Controller Mappings on OS X?
data.body:
Has this already been addressed by another PR? To get my PS3 controllers working, I had to tweak the logic / mappings in Desktop/Input/GamePad.cs:AutoConfig().

Closest I saw in existing issues were for:
- 360 controller on OS X (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1614) and 
- official PS3 controller on Linux (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/177).

I've tested the fix with 3rd-party and official controller. If someone's not already working the issue, I can do a branch and PR for this.

data.title: MacOS templates do not bundle the content
data.body:
From http://jaquadro.com/2013/09/monogame-hello-world-on-mac-os-x-and-xamarin-studio/

---

If you pry into the exception, you’ll see that it couldn’t load the “logo” content item because an expected file is missing. In my case, that path is the heinously long “/Users/jaquadro/Projects/DemoGame/DemoGame/bin/Debug/DemoGame.app/Contents/Resources/Content/logo.xnb”.

The Content/logo.xnb in the path corresponds to the Content/logo.png in your project. This file should be getting copied into your built app package (DemoGame.app), but if you manually poke around in Finder, you won’t even find a Resources directory in DemoGame.app/Contents.

If you examine the Build Action of Content/logo.png, you’ll see it’s set to ‘None’. Instead, this should be set to ‘BundleResource’, which will cause it to be copied into the app bundle. I have also found the ‘Content’ build action to do the same thing, but official word is ‘Content’ is obsolete and don’t use it.

---

I'm guessing in the next release we will simply include the content project but if not this should be fixed in the template

data.title: Clean install of MonoDevelop .mpack to Xamarin studio uses wrong reference
data.body:
Clean install of Xamarin Studio 4.2.2
Clean install of the MonoDevelop.mpack from the 3.01 release
Create new Mono.Game project
Run 

App fails to run gives errors about MonoGame.Framework

Check references and see that the WindowsGL assembly is referenced by default

Try to disable that and enable the MacOS one and notice that the WindowsGL one gets reselected. Impossible to choose the MacOS version

Only solution appears to be to pull and build the source. Not very user friendly.

Problem also described with pictures here http://jaquadro.com/2013/09/monogame-hello-world-on-mac-os-x-and-xamarin-studio/

I've not tried this with MonoDevelop so not sure if it would repro there or not
